required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Use Investigation Of Azithromycin IV For Pneumonia Or Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (Regulatory Post Marketing Commitment Plan)
clinical_study.official_title: Drug Use Investigation Of Azithromycin Iv

brief_summary.textblock: To collect the efficacy and safety information of Azithromycin IV related to their appropriate use in daily practice

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: A treatment-related adverse event was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) in a participant who received Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets). A treatment-related serious adverse event was a treatment-related adverse event resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; lifethreatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Relatedness to Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) was assessed by the physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Effectiveness Rate in Participants With Pneumonia
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical effectiveness rate in participants with pneumonia, which was defined as the percentage of participants who achieved clinical effectiveness over the total number of asssable effectiveness analysis population with pneumonia, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Clinical effectiveness of Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) was determined by the physician based on clinical symptoms and laboratory findings, and assessed according to the following categories: (1) effective, (2) ineffective, or (3) unassessable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Effectiveness Rate in Participants With Pelvic Inflammatory Disease
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical effectiveness rate in pelvic inflammatory disease (PID), which was defined as the percentage of participants who achieved clinical effectiveness over the total number of asssable effectiveness analysis population with PID, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Clinical effectiveness of Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) was determined by the physician based on clinical symptoms and laboratory findings, and assessed according to the following categories: (1) effective, (2) ineffective, or (3) unassessable.

arm_group.description: Subjects who are treated with Azithromycin IV

intervention.description: The recommended dose of ZITHROMAC (azithromycin for injection) for the treatment of adult patients with pneumonia due to the indicated organisms is: 500 mg as a single daily dose by the intravenous route for at least two days. Intravenous therapy should be followed by azithromycin by the oral route at a single, daily dose of 500 mg, administered as two 250-mg tablets to complete a 7- to 10-day course of therapy. The recommended dose of ZITHROMAC (azithromycin for injection) for the treatment of adult patients with pelvic inflammatory disease due to the indicated organisms is: 500 mg as a single daily dose by the intravenous route for one or two days. Intravenous therapy should be followed by azithromycin by the oral route at a single, daily dose of 250 mg to complete a 7-day course of therapy.

study_pop.textblock: The patients whom an investigator involviong A0661207 prescribes the Zithromac IV.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or Female patients who are prescribed Zithromac IV for pneumonia or pelvic inflammatory disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have been prescribed Zithromac IV for pneumonia or pelvic inflammatory disease.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Zithromac Intravenous Use (Azithromycin Hydrate)
group.description: Participants who received Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) as indicated in the approved local product document were observed for a period of 29 days. The dosage can be adjusted as per physician’s discretion.

baseline.population: A total of 401 participants completed this study. Of the 401 participants, 1 participant was excluded from the baseline analysis due to protocol violation.

group.title: Zithromac Intravenous Use (Azithromycin Hydrate)
group.description: Participants who received Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) as indicated in the approved local product document were observed for a period of 29 days. The dosage can be adjusted as per physician’s discretion.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events
outcome.description: A treatment-related adverse event was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) in a participant who received Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets). A treatment-related serious adverse event was a treatment-related adverse event resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; lifethreatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Relatedness to Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) was assessed by the physician.
outcome.population: The safety analysis set comprised of participants who satisfied the inclusion criteria and received Zithromac Intravenous use at least once.

group.title: Zithromac Intravenous Use (Azithromycin Hydrate)
group.description: Participants who received Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) as indicated in the approved local product document were observed for a period of 29 days. The dosage can be adjusted as per physician’s discretion.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events
measure.description: A treatment-related adverse event was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) in a participant who received Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets). A treatment-related serious adverse event was a treatment-related adverse event resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; lifethreatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Relatedness to Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) was assessed by the physician.
measure.population: The safety analysis set comprised of participants who satisfied the inclusion criteria and received Zithromac Intravenous use at least once.

outcome.title: Clinical Effectiveness Rate in Participants With Pneumonia
outcome.description: Clinical effectiveness rate in participants with pneumonia, which was defined as the percentage of participants who achieved clinical effectiveness over the total number of asssable effectiveness analysis population with pneumonia, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Clinical effectiveness of Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) was determined by the physician based on clinical symptoms and laboratory findings, and assessed according to the following categories: (1) effective, (2) ineffective, or (3) unassessable.
outcome.population: The effectiveness analysis set comprised of participants in the safety analysis set who had effectiveness evaluation of pneumonia (overall evaluation by the physician based upon change in clinical symptoms and laboratory findings) at least once. Participants evaluated as "unassessable" were excluded from the calculation.

reported_events.desc: The frequency of adverse events. The same event may appear as both an adverse event and a serious adverse event. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Zithromac Intravenous Use (Azithromycin Hydrate)
group.description: Participants who received Zithromac Intravenous use (and Zithromac Tablets) as indicated in the approved local product document were observed for a period of 29 days. The dosage can be adjusted as per physician’s discretion.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
